strategy: Apply a deep neural network (DNN) with multiple hidden layers and batch normalization, using a residual connection architecture to improve convergence and generalization. Instead of relying on tree-based models, this approach captures highly non-linear patterns in the data through dense feature transformations. Preprocess features with logarithmic scaling and normalize inputs using z-scores. Use a validation set with early stopping based on R2 score to prevent overfitting. Train the model with dropout layers (10–20%) to enhance robustness. This strategy shifts from tree-based ensembles to a neural architecture capable of modeling complex, non-linear interactions that may not be fully captured by gradient boosting.
